entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French atendre, from Latin attendere, literally, to stretch to, from ad- + tendere to stretch thin

def.dt: :to look after :take charge of campsites…attended by park rangers Jackson Rivers
:to go or stay with as a companion, nurse, or servant
:to visit professionally especially as a physician
:to be present at :go to attend law school
:to apply oneself attend to your work
:to apply the mind or pay attention :heed
:to be ready for service ministers who attend upon the king
:to direct one's attention :see I'll attend to that
